docs.snippet: The new owners of a beloved Brooklyn spot aim for a more stylish restaurant than is typical in Park Slope, with local, seasonal Italian fare.

headline.print_headline: In Park Slope, a Stylish Restaurant Centering on Wine
headline.main: Fausto, in Franny’s Old Space, Will Focus on Wine

docs.snippet: Sugarcane Raw Bar Grill from Miami and Las Vegas, Celestine from a team of experienced restaurateurs, and a brewpub from the group behind Randolph Beer are all opening in the area.

headline.print_headline: Pull Up a Seat in Dumbo
headline.main: Dumbo Stakes Its Claim as a Dining Destination

docs.snippet: After reviewing a female trainee’s assault allegations, the Army found signs of more misconduct. The fort only recently allowed women into its training programs.

headline.print_headline: Fort Benning Drill Sergeants Suspended Amid Sexual Misconduct Allegations
headline.main: Fort Benning Drill Sergeants Suspended Amid Sexual Misconduct Allegations

docs.snippet: Established restaurants in Japan and China will feed New Yorkers this fall with distinctive cuisine.

headline.main: From Kaiseki to Ramen, a Fresh Shipment of Asian Imports

docs.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate weight loss vs. wellness, Gen. John Kelly’s presence in the White House and affirmative action.

headline.main: ‘I’m Still Overweight, but Much Happier and Healthier’

docs.snippet: Tuesday: Talking to U.C. Berkeley’s new chancellor, a shake-up at The Los Angeles Times, and your eclipse photos.

headline.main: California Today: Berkeley’s New Chancellor and a ‘Free Speech Year’

docs.snippet: The digital payment giant doesn’t count the stock grants it gives to employees as an expense. This makes its earnings look prettier to Wall Street.

headline.main: The Accounting Tack That Makes PayPal’s Numbers Look So Good

docs.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate being interrupted at work, the shooting of a politician and the fate of American “Dreamers.”

docs.snippet: Details emerged of the 10 sailors who were missing after a collision between the destroyer John S. McCain and an oil tanker.

docs.snippet: Readers debated race-based admissions policies after The New York Times reported that the Department of Justice may take on affirmative action in college admissions.
